alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Southern Columbia; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 12:46PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bradford, Union and southeastern Columbia Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Upland Pines, or near Worthington Spring, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Raiford, Worthington Spring, Worthington Springs, Palestine Community, Groves, Providence, Beasley, New River and Upland Pines. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
